Posted By: LordCapulet (4/15/2010 10:00:03 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The Eldrazi are certainly very powerful. Just remember, "powerful" is not the same thing as "good."
  
Let's compare Kozilek to our go-to powerhouse card, [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel). Kozilek seems better, right? Because for 10 mana, your getting 12/12; better than 5 for 5/5, right? Well, not really.
  
Let me tell you a little story about a little thing called Tempo. Back in the old days of Alpha, Timmy Players ran rampant through the game. It was basically:
  
T1: land, go
  
T2: land, go
  
...
  
T6: [force of nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=force of nature).
  
But then some genius thought, "Hey! What if I use cheap creatures to kill my opponent before he *gets* to 6 mana?" And thus, tempo was born.
  
Yes, kozilek is powerful. But seriously, between a turn 5 drop that basically wins for you ([baneslayer angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=baneslayer angel)) and a turn 10 drop that basically wins for you (kozilek) which would you prefer?
  
and yes, you can ramp your mana. You can ramp your mana to obscene proportions to play Kozile... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
The Eldrazi are certainly very powerful. Just remember, "powerful" is not the same thing as "good."
Let's compare Kozilek to our go-to powerhouse card, Baneslayer Angel. Kozilek seems better, right? Because for 10 mana, your getting 12/12; better than 5 for 5/5, right? Well, not really.
Let me tell you a little story about a little thing called Tempo. Back in the old days of Alpha, Timmy Players ran rampant through the game. It was basically:
T1: land, go
T2: land, go
...
T6: force of nature.
But then some genius thought, "Hey! What if I use cheap creatures to kill my opponent before he gets to 6 mana?" And thus, tempo was born.
Yes, kozilek is powerful. But seriously, between a turn 5 drop that basically wins for you (baneslayer angel) and a turn 10 drop that basically wins for you (kozilek) which would you prefer?
and yes, you can ramp your mana. You can ramp your mana to obscene proportions to play Kozile... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Eldrazi and their Drones? [Tsabo's Decree](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tsabo's Decree).
  
   
Eldrazi Legends?
  
[Tsabo Tavoc](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tsabo Tavoc) can block [Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre) all day long without taking a single point of damage; she can straight kill Kozilek here (although, [Phthisis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phthisis) is much more fun); and not even [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn ) can get past her as long as you have the 2 mana [Phyrexian Splicer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Splicer) in play to strip away his flying (and its an artifact so his protection is worthless).
  
   
Annihilator mechanic got you down? Start up the [Phyrexian Processor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Processor). Didn't get to it in time? [Yawgmoth's Agenda](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Agenda) means those lost permanents are never too far away.
  
   
Phyrexia laughs at your "aether born" abominations.
  
   
   
On a more serious note conerning the "over powered" nature of the Eldrazi. That's a true statement when you consider them in isolation. Annihilator may be an awesomely... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Eldrazi and their Drones? Tsabo's Decree.

Eldrazi Legends?
Tsabo Tavoc can block Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre all day long without taking a single point of damage; she can straight kill Kozilek here (although, Phthisis is much more fun); and not even Emrakul, the Aeons Torn can get past her as long as you have the 2 mana Phyrexian Splicer in play to strip away his flying (and its an artifact so his protection is worthless).

Annihilator mechanic got you down? Start up the Phyrexian Processor. Didn't get to it in time? Yawgmoth's Agenda means those lost permanents are never too far away.

Phyrexia laughs at your "aether born" abominations.

Posted By: Kindulas (12/21/2010 10:40:26 PM)

posts.post_content:
Out of the three, Kozilek is the best.  
  
He is the only competitive-worthy Eldrazi lord. This is because he gives you card advantage, which is something that is always sorely underestimated. Also, he is the farthest under the curve between the three. Again, overlooked. Not the flashiest, but the most efficient. Spike.  
  
Then again, are the three legendary Eldrazi actually competitive in the standard environment?...  
  
 Good luck.
posts.html:

Then again, are the three legendary Eldrazi actually competitive in the standard environment?...

posts.post_content:
best Eldrazi, heres why. half his cost goes to an colorless uncounterable [Tidings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tidings), since its when u cast him. Then, ur left with a 12/12 annihilator 4 for...5  
While tidings isnt the greatest card draw spell, it isnt that bad, and the fact that its tacked on is even more card advantage. Sure it costs a lot, but i dont think that destroying a permenant is better, and emarkul is just too hard to cast, at least hardcast. (zing!)

posts.post_content: This guy is probably the best of the three Eldrazi, although I have a personal soft spot for the over-the-top Timmyness of Emrakul. Coming up with 10 mana isn't really that difficult in RotE, and he IS a better value than the other two. All this aside, though, the thing I like most about him is that [Artisan of Kozilek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Artisan of Kozilek) can't bring him back.
